comment.author: 31385389@N08
comment._content:
I think the birth date should be 1889 not 1899.
His Canadian records state born 9 March 1889, father Arthur R. Vizard (although the 1891 and 1901 UK Censuses give it as 1891).

comment.author: 32300107@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lcriding] You're right - well noted - it's the date of birth that is incorrect, which was 1889 as stated on his attestation paper: www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/databases/cef/001042-119.02-e...

comment.author: 31385389@N08
comment._content: Looking again at the 1891 UK Census, he is definitely listed as being one month old.  (The Census was taken on 5 April 1891).  He has an older brother Arthur W.J. Vizard, who is listed as 2 years old.  I wonder if Ernest 'borrowed' his brother's birth date for some strange reason.  I know boys often put their ages up to get accepted in the forces but there was no need in this instance.
